levelledPara.title: Location and Role
levelledPara.para: Frame C0 is located at Fuselage Station 350. It serves as the structural anchor for the BH-STA350 forward pressure bulkhead and defines the transition between the pressurized fuselage and the radome sensor bay.

levelledPara.title: Construction
levelledPara.para: The frame is constructed from AL-2024-T3 and reinforced with localized doublers at bolt hole locations. It features a 10-hole radial interface pattern for bulkhead attachment and includes provisions for firewall integration.

levelledPara.title: Interfaces
levelledPara.para: Frame C0 interfaces with the BH-STA350 bulkhead, the firewall layer, and the surrounding fuselage skin panels. It also supports the mechanical and electromagnetic sealing of the radome interface.

levelledPara.title: Compliance
levelledPara.para: Frame C0 is designed to meet structural load requirements under CS-25.561 and supports systems requiring electromagnetic shielding and thermal isolation per DO-160G.
